oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Energy dependence of near-relativistic electron spectrum at geostationary orbit during the SEP events of 2005
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: REDDY, AC
RATHOD, J
RAJARAM, G
ALYANA, R
MISRA, DS
PATIL, CG
PRASAD, MYS
ANANTH, AG
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: magnetosphere
sep events
shocks
geostationary orbit
reds
rees
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In view of the renewed interest in the study of energetic particles in the outer radiation belt of the earth, we feel it will be helpful in looking for the energy dependence of the electron energy spectrum at geostationary orbit. This may give us some insight into how we can safeguard geostationary satellites from functional anomalies of the deep dielectric charging type, which are caused by charge accumulation and subsequent discharge of relativistic electrons. In this study we examine whether there is any energy dependence in relativistic electron enhancements at geosynchronous altitudes during solar energetic proton events of 2005.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Challenges for Solar Cycle 24,Ahmedabad, INDIA,JAN 22-25, 2007
